fields.description:
In Service Desk Customer Portal, clicking on *My requests* works and redirects to the following link:
* http(s)://<jira-url>/servicedesk/customer/portal/8/user/requests?status=current

However, the status bar actually shows the following link when hovering the mouse over "My requests":
* http(s)://<jira-url>/servicedesk/customer/portal/8/my/requests?status=current
(!) notice the difference between *user* and *my*

(x) Opening this link in a new tab will redirect to a *dead link*.
fields.summary: My requests does not work when opened in a new tab

JIRA OnDemand:

We have this problem:
Now, the Notifications settings for Jira Service Desk at the system is disable.
We use the JIRA notification scheme associated with the Project.
For example, when a problem is resolved, the notification arrive the mail queue, but when the message is sent automatically this does not arrive the receiver. Only the Created Issue notification arrive correctly.
Before, we had the Notifications settings for JIRA Service Desk activate, and all users received the emails correctly.

Please, do you can help?

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a support request from the Customer Portal
!sds_1.jpg|thumbnail!
# By default, the status of the ticket will be "Waiting for Support".
!sds_2.jpg|thumbnail!
!sds_4.jpg|thumbnail!
# A support agent responds to the support request which changes the status of the ticket to "Waiting for Customer".
!sds_5.jpg|thumbnail!
!sds_6.jpg|thumbnail!
# When the customer replies back via portal, the status of the ticket is changing to "Waiting for Support", but when the customer replied via email, the comment has been added, but the status is not changed. It is still "Waiting for Customer".
* Comment via Portal
!sds_11.jpg|thumbnail!
!sds_12.jpg|thumbnail!
!sds_13.jpg|thumbnail!
* Comment via Mail
!sds_8.jpg|thumbnail!
!sds_9.jpg|thumbnail!
!sds_10.jpg|thumbnail!

Expected behaviour:
The status must be changed to "Waiting for Support" when the customer commented via email. 

Issue is reproducible using JIRA 6.2.7 and JIRA Service Desk 1.2.6.1
fields.summary: Issues are not transitioning when commenting via email

  {panel}

I know that a lot of people have mentioned either allowing multiple projects per service desk.   

As a cheap, relatively easy fix, could we add a static link feature to the 'Request Types' in the Customer Portal?  

Example:  
Technical Desk
 - Server Support
 - Program Support
 - Bug Report
 - Sales Support (This could be a hyperlink to one of our other Service Desks)


I think this is a relatively quick work around that would allow customers to seamlessly integrate Service Desks.  Also it would allow direct links to other areas if necessary.
fields.summary: Allow addition of static links in Request Types

Hi,

I updated the plugin to 1.2.6.1 last Friday on our jira. In notification scheme of a project, only assignee should get email. Also I have disabled "SEND_EMAIL_NOTIFICATIONS" in db table AO_54307E_VIEWPORT of the project.

While the issue is after the updating, reporters keep getting emails from the service desk. 

Now I disabled two modules notifications-soy & notification-filter-impl of the plugin and reporters don't get any email any more.

Is it correct way to disable reporter notification? I think assignee will not get any notification if I disabled the two modules. 

Is there any other better way to do this?

Thanks in advance
Hailin

fields.description:
Holiday date has user locale dependent representation in REST API.
It's not very obvious way to represent date in machine-oriented programming interfaces. Because to properly parse application should get user locale first and only after this step try to parse.

Holiday date should be in ISO-8601 format like any other date in JIRA REST API.
fields.summary: [WorkingHours Plugin] User locale dependent date representation in Calendars REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-625].
  {panel}

Follow up to the original issue: JSD-95

h6. Problem
With the fix in JSD-95, Service Desk detects new tickets when the "Issue Created Event" is triggered during the clone operation. If this event is removed from the workflow, then Service Desk does not reset the SLA.

h6. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a new Service Desk Project
* Modify the "Create" transition of the related workflow and remove the "Issue Created Event"
* Publish the workflow
* Create a new Service Desk Request
* Wait a bit for the SLA to count down
* Clone the issue
* SLA is not reset

h6. Workaround
* Ensure that the "Create Issue Event" is part of the workflow's Create transition
fields.summary: Clone Issue does not reset SLA if Issue Created Event is not triggered

fields.description:
Pause on condition preventing stop condition from triggering, resulting in SLA that neither pauses nor stops.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Create SLA
** Start: Issue Created
** Pause on: Assignee:Set
** Stop: Assignee:From Unassigned
** Goal: All remaining: 1h
* Create new ticket that this SLA applies to. Create as unassigned.
* View issue, click Assign to me

*Expected behavior*
SLA stops per stop condition assignee changed from unassigned

*Experienced behavior*
SLA does not stop nor does it pause. Continues to count down even though ticket is assigned (meets pause condition)
fields.summary: Conflicting pause and stop conditions prevent SLA from stopping

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-612].
  {panel}

When you change the configuration of the SLA then Service Desk does not "rewrite history". This means if it is changed it may not affect previous issues. For example:

* JSP-1 and JSP-2 are raised.
* The SLA is changed. JSP-1 does not appear to be updated.

When the re-calculate SLA code runs after an SLA config change it sees that and deems JSP-1 as not ongoing and hence it does not "re-invent" that JSP-1 met SLA under the new rules.  Instead it clears that SLA was ever met.

Now why does it do that?  

Well its because the semantics of re-writing SLA history is complicated and invokes existential dilemmas that only the like of Emmanuelle Kant, Renee Descartes and [~miruflin] can answer. So instead of pretending that SLA where met or not met, SD decides they never existed. We could do a better job in informing the user of the impact of the SLA change at the time of the change and have raised issue JSD-494 for this.

At the minimum please enhance the product so that it warns users about this.
fields.summary: Enhance JIRA Service Desk so that it provides better support for SLA changes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I've reviewed the behaviours described in JSD-446 as well as JSD-550 and even though it is supposed to have been fixed I must say I'm facing something different: regardless of "JIRA Service Desk notifications" being globally turned off, the reporter wouldn't get notification on issue creation nor issue commented (in this case they would receive for comments but oddly enough not for the first comment), although users granted other roles (Service Desk Team, Project admin) would get these notifications.
fields.summary: Reporter does not receive notifications when creating issues without using ServiceDesk customer portal, even with JSD notification set to 'off'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-604].
  {panel}

When trying to connect a ServiceDesk project to a Confluence space, and the Confluence instance does not allow anonymous access (presumably), the following error is always rendered:


!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/157981/FfTOlUDSuwMA3Ry/Selection_086.png!


The AppLink is correctly configured on both ends, and other JIRA to Confluence integration which relies on the AppLink is also correctly working.
For example: on a JIRA issue page, you can correctly link to a confluence page by searching for the page to link to, in the JIRA issue link dialog. 

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/121256/Find%20a%20Confluence%20page%20-%20Atlassian%20JIRA%20Extranet%20-%20Special%20Projects%202014-06-19%2013-32-38%202014-06-19%2013-33-19.jpg!

Step to reproduce:

# create Select List type custom field
# add 3000 options to the custom field

{panel:bgColor=#FFFFCE}h6.Update - open signup in Service Desk 2.0 
This ticket was closed as Service Desk couldn't work with JIRA's public signup. Please note, though, that as of Service Desk 2.0, it's possible to enable public signup for specific Service Desks - in those cases, the _Sign up for an account_ link will be displayed in the Service Desk's login page. More details can be found in the documentation: [Configuring public signup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Configuring+public+signup].

fields.description:
h6. Problem
If an Administrator does not have the *Browse Project* permission, nothing happens during the creation of a new Service Desk project.
* No indication of project creation, no page reload, no messaging. The page simply sits there

h6. Steps to Reproduce
* Log in as a System Adminsitrator
* Remove *Browse Project* permissions
* Attempt to create a new Service Desk Project
* Notice that nothing happens. There is no indication of any response in the web browser, the page just sits there.
** Note the project is indeed created, but it is not Service Desk enabled.

h6. Expected Behaviour
* There should be some sort of response to indicate that the Service Desk project has been created, but the user does not have permission to access it.
fields.summary: No Response when Creating a new Service Desk Project without Browse Project Permission

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-584].
  {panel}

h4. Summary

The "Ready for Support" transition has been renamed to "Respond to Support". This is due to a simplification of the default Service Desk workflow, but unfortunately affects any existing workflow. The underlying cause is that the "jira.i18n.title" value "sd.workflow.itsupport.transition.waitsup.title" was used for the "Ready for Support" step, but has been re-used for "Respond to Support".

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# While JIRA Service Desk 1.2.5 or below is installed, create a new service desk project, and use the default workflow
# Upgrade to version 1.2.6.1 or above
# Create a service desk request
# Observe that the transition is now called "Respond to Support" while the issue is in "Waiting for Triage" state.
fields.summary: "Ready for Support" transition renamed to "Respond to Support" in "Waiting for Triage" status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-574].
  {panel}

- It is possible to bulk edit the "Request Type" fields from issues that have the same Issue Type
- However, it is not possible to bulk edit the "Request Type" fields from issues that have mixed Issue Types

The reason for this limitation comes from the fact that Request Type of an issue can only be set to a value that is associated to the issue type.
If we try to edit issues from different types, changing the Request Type of all these issues to the same value will be dangerous and might lead to data corruption since the Request Type might not be compatible with the issue type of some issues.

It would be nice to have a feature that allows to edit the request type of issues from mixed issue types in a way that is not "dangerous" and that respects the compatibility between Request Types and Issue Types.
fields.summary: Enable Bulk Update Request Type from issues of Mixed Issue Types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-558].
  {panel}

h3.Symptoms
Submitting an issue through service desk fails. The create button gets disabled and re-enabled without proceeding to the issue page.

No feedback is provided to the user on the successful creation of the issue.
No warning is displayed indicating a hidden field will affect the issue creation process

h3.How to reproduce
# Open customer portal
# Click any request type, e.g. "Get IT Help"
# Fill in request form
# Click "Create"
# Hour glass appears and button is greyed out...
# After a while, the "Create" button is re-enabled.
# The request is created and can be seen inside JIRA.
# The request cannot be seen by the customer under Customer Portal > Requests.

Also, on Chrome Developer Tool, the create AJAX call triggers a 404 Not Found page:
Example:
{code}https://<instance>/servicedesk/customer/portal/<servicedesk_id>/create/<form_id>{code}

h3.Diagnosis
* The problem occurs when the 'Customer Request Type' field is hidden in the issue type field configuration.
* The root cause is the default Issue Type's Field Configuration has  'Customer Request Type' hidden. On creating a new service desk, the default field configuration is cloned.
* This also happens if the issue type is not properly assigned to the 'Customer Request Type' field in the field context.

h3.How to resolve
h4.Resolving existing service desks
# Browse to each project where Service Desk is enabled.
# Browse to the project 'Administration' page.
# Browse to 'Issue Types' from the left-side menu.
# Browse to the 'Field Configuration' specified for the issue type.
# Scroll down to the 'Customer Request Type' field.
# If it is hidden, press the 'Show' link to make it visible,
# Repeat for each different Field Configuration on the Issue Types page.

h4.Resolving the default field configuration
This will prevent service desks created in the future from being affected with the same problem.
# Browse to JIRA Administration > Issues > Field Configuration
# The default field configuration is the one without an 'Edit' button. Browse to the default field configuration.
# Scroll down to field 'Customer Request Type' and 'Show' the field.
fields.summary: Submitting an issue through service desk when 'Customer Issue Type' field is hidden should not be allowed

Greetings,

It is possible to have a revision number for screens and workflows in the event that they get altered?  We ran into a scenario where a workflow (that was shared by multiple departments) was altered in a way that ended up breaking other group's workflows.  The steps it took to recover everything were painful and long, a way to track and revert such alterations would really be helpful.

Thank you,
-rob

For a project which is associated with ServiceDesk, if a user creates a Service Desk Request (through the Customer Portal), then notifications are sent correctly according to [JSD-323|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-323].

However, if an issue is created normally by clicking on Create Issue button (same project) or via email through a mail handler (same project, no matter Default Reporter or recognized user), then the Reporter does not receive any notifications at all, including Issue Creation, Issue Updated, Issue Commented, and Issue Resolved.
(!) *This does not happen when ServiceDesk is disabled*, hence ServiceDesk must have affected JIRA notifications in an unexpected manner.
